title: What is this modern nouveau font please?
content:
Hello

Could someone help me identify this font please? I've seen lots of similar looking fonts but can't quite put my finger on this one.

Thanks in advance

[http://www.ill-studio.com/works/-/176-nc-booklet.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422/http:/www.ill-studio.com/works/-/176-nc-booklet.htm "http://www.ill-studio.com/works/-/176-nc-booklet.htm")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ill_works_176_visuel_nr6r_3670.jpg)

Font: 

 Penguin Font by Ill Studio 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ill\_works\_176\_visuel\_nr6r.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422/http:/typophile.com/files/ill_works_176_visuel_nr6r.jpg) | 49.14 KB |
author: mcfee

comments.content:
A search for fonts tagged "experimental" turned up some similar fonts, but so far no match.  
Don

It may be a customization of Suburban, by Emigre:  
 [http://www.emigre.com/OT/Suburban](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422/http:/www.emigre.com/OT/Suburban "http://www.emigre.com/OT/Suburban")

Ah, it appears to be called Penguin Type, by Ill Studio (who designed the booklet in your sample):  
 [http://www.ill-studio.com/works/view-all/136-penguin-type.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422/http:/www.ill-studio.com/works/view-all/136-penguin-type.htm "http://www.ill-studio.com/works/view-all/136-penguin-type.htm")  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-63849.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417135422/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-63849.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-63849.html")
Unbalanced forms, lack of optical compensations, abrupt transitions from straight to round = graphic designer posing as type designer.
Ah kthomps5 fantastic! Well spotted! Thanks for the experimental type links too :-)
